channel.title: Maps on Ángela Castillo-Gill
channel.description: Recent content in Maps on Ángela Castillo-Gill

item.title: Linear regression: who tends to download R software
item.description: 1 Summary 2 Question 3 Dataset description 4 The relationship between the education index and R downloads 5 Conclusion 1 Summary To see the code used in this post, visit my kernel on kaggle in R Markdown format. 2 Question 3 Dataset description I used the Tidy Tuesday dataset for R downloads posted on 30th October 2018. The dataset contained 938,115 observations and eight features corresponding to a unique id, download date, time, size, version, os, country, and IP id.

item.title: R-Downloads around the world
item.description: 1 Summary 2 Question 3 Dataset description 3.1 Total R Downloads 3.2 Total R Downloads per capita 3.3 Times of the year with most downloads 4 Conclusion 1 Summary To see the code used in this post, visit my kernel on kaggle in R Markdown format. In this blogpost I analysed a dataset containing downloads of the R software in one year, spanning from October 2017 to 2018.
